metadata.title: CVE-2024-56630 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ocfs2: free inode when ocfs2_get_init_inode() failssyzbot is reporting busy inodes after unmount, for commit 9c89fe0af826("ocfs2: Handle error from dquot_initialize()") forgot to call iput() whennew_inode() succeeded and dquot_initialize() failed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-56630` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-199-generic - 3.13.0-173.224
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-199-lowlatency - 3.13.0-173.224
Available with Ubuntu Pro with Legacy support add-on: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-173.224').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
